content: 2022 Singaporean crime film ***Geylang*** ([Chinese](/wiki/Chinese_language): 芽笼) is a 2022 Singaporean crime thriller film produced and directed by Boi Kwong. The second feature film by Kwong, the film is set in the [red-light district](/wiki/Red-light_district) of [Geylang](/wiki/Geylang) and revolves around the intertwined fates of five individuals over the course of one night. It had its world premiere at the [Taipei Golden Horse Film Festival](/wiki/Taipei_Golden_Horse_Film_Festival) in November 2022 and was released in theatres on 6 April 2023. ## Cast - [Mark Lee](/wiki/Mark_Lee_(Singaporean_actor)) as Fatty - [Sheila Sim](/wiki/Sheila_Sim_(Singaporean_actress)) as Celine - Shane Mardjuki as Dr. Sun - Gary Lau as Jie - Patricia Lin as Shangri-La - Agung Bagus as Yunji - Benny Se Teo as Hor Sin - Eric Chow as Five Ji - Lee V.Feto as Lowot ## Release Following its world premiere at the [Taipei Golden Horse Film Festival](/wiki/Taipei_Golden_Horse_Film_Festival), the film subsequently screened at the [Singapore International Film Festival](/wiki/Singapore_International_Film_Festival) and also at the [International Film Festival Rotterdam](/wiki/International_Film_Festival_Rotterdam) in the [Netherlands](/wiki/Netherlands) in January 2023. ## Critical reception In a review for *[8 Days](/wiki/8_Days_(magazine))*, Tay Yek Keak rated the film 3 out of 5 stars. Tay praised Mark Lee's portrayal as the "beleaguered but good-hearted" pimp Fatty, but felt the film was too over-the-top. ## Awards and nominations AwardsCategoryRecipientResultRef.[59th Golden Horse Awards](/wiki/59th_Golden_Horse_Awards)[Best Action Choreography](/wiki/Golden_Horse_Award_for_Best_Action_Choreography)Sunny PangNominated[FIPRESCI Prize](/wiki/FIPRESCI_Prize)—N/aNominated - *Geylang* at [IMDb](/wiki/IMDb_(identifier)) This article related to a Singaporean film is a stub. title: Geylang (film)
